The **`text-decoration`** shorthand CSS property sets the appearance of decorative lines on text. It is a shorthand for `text-decoration-line`, `text-decoration-color`, `text-decoration-style`, and the newer `text-decoration-thickness` property.

This property supports responsive values. You can pass a single value like `"auto"`.

 Or an object like:
 
 ```
{
  "xs": "auto",
  "md": "blink",
  "lg": "dashed",
  "xl": "dotted"
}
```

- auto

- dashed
- dotted

props.description:
The **`text-align`** CSS property sets the horizontal alignment of aÂ block element or table-cell box. This means it works like `vertical-align` but in the horizontal direction.


**Initial value**: `start`, or a nameless value that acts as `left` if _direction_ is `ltr`, `right` if _direction_ is `rtl` if `start` is not supported by the browser.

This property supports responsive values. You can pass a single value like `"center"`.

 Or an object like:
 
 ```
{
  "xs": "center",
  "md": "end",
  "lg": "justify",
  "xl": "left"
}
```

- center
- end
- justify
- left
- match-parent
- right
- start

props.description:
The **`text-transform`** CSS property specifies how to capitalize an element's text. It can be used to make text appear in all-uppercase or all-lowercase, or with each word capitalized. It also can help improve legibility for ruby.


**Initial value**: `none`

This property supports responsive values. You can pass a single value like `"capitalize"`.

 Or an object like:
 
 ```
{
  "xs": "capitalize",
  "md": "full-size-kana",
  "lg": "full-width",
  "xl": "lowercase"
}
```

- capitalize
- full-size-kana
- full-width
- lowercase
- none
- uppercase

props.description:
The **`width`** CSS property sets an element's width. By default, it sets the width of the content area, but if `box-sizing` is set to `border-box`, it sets the width of the border area. It is also possible to pass a specific value.


**Initial value**: `auto`

This property supports responsive values. You can pass a single value like `"auto"`.

 Or an object like:
 
 ```
{
  "xs": "auto",
  "md": "fit-content",
  "lg": "intrinsic",
  "xl": "max-content"
}
```

- auto
- fit-content
- intrinsic
- max-content
- min-content
- min-intrinsic
- stretch
